title: Nobel Peace Prize: Maria Ressa and Dmitry Muratov share joy over win
content: This video can not be playedJournalists Maria Ressa and Dmitry Muratov told the BBC's Hardtalk programme about the shared disbelief they felt over winning the Nobel Peace Prize.Winning the prize for their fights to defend freedom of expression in the Philippines and Russia respectively, Ressa and Muratov are both known for publishing investigations that have angered the leaders of their countries.
